11123.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"785tq","text":"Each RNA sample must be run in triplicate in both the LN34 and β-actin (βA) real-time PCR assays (6 reactions per sample).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":4},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":45,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ek5h4","text":"Three no template control reactions must be run in both the LN34 and β-actin (βA) real-time PCR assays (6 reactions per plate).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":4},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":51,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eb7k8","text":"Three positive control RNA reactions must be run in the LN34 real-time RT-PCR assay (3 reactions per plate). Running and monitoring the Ct value of the LN34 positive control is critical to assuring assay sensitivity within a laboratory over time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ejkg","text":"Three positive control reactions should be run in the βA real-time PCR assay (3 reactions per plate). Positive control RNA for the βA assay can be a previously tested extracted whole RNA sample or commercially available β-actin RNA may be purchased.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"42ek0","text":"Reaction assay mixtures (master mixes) containing all components except template should be made as cocktails and dispensed into the reaction plate or tubes. RNA, positive control RNA or water should then be added to the respective test and control wells","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

11123.section: Prepare Master Mixes for LN34 and βA Assays
11123.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hop4","text":"Label one microcentrifuge tube per assay (LN34 and βA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

11123.section: Prepare Master Mixes for LN34 and βA Assays
11123.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1l9rv","text":"Determine the number of reactions (N) to set up per assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fi986","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h64l","text":"Calculate the number of reactions for the LN34 assay by multiplying the number of samples by three and add 6 for control reaction wells.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"74nke","text":"Calculate the number of reactions for the βA assay by multiplying the number of samples and add 6 for control reaction wells. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3drk2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

11123.section: Prepare Master Mixes for LN34 and βA Assays

11123.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4qo2","text":"Designate and label wells for each sample to run in triplicate for both the LN34 assay and βA assay","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"carp3","text":"Dispense reagents for the LN34 assay into the LN34-labeled microcentrifuge tube. Briefly vortex and centrifuge prior to dispensing 23 µl of master mix into each LN34 assigned well. Avoid introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"da3ni","text":"Dispense reagents for βA assay into the βA-labeled microcentrifuge tube. Briefly vortex and centrifuge prior to dispensing 23 µl master mix into βA assigned wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c2a62","text":"Briefly vortex and centrifuge the tubes containing the RNA samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pfb8","text":"Pipette 2 µl of extracted RNA from the first sample into each well labeled for that sample. Avoid introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fd4tt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nn18","text":"Repeat for the remaining samples and the positive control RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehse9","text":"After the addition of the last sample/control, place the optical adhesive cover over the wells, being sure to cover all the wells and seal completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"310j8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8v7tf","text":"Optional: briefly vortex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etatl","text":"Centrifuge at 500 × g for 1 min at room temperature or tap down samples on tabletop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vejq","text":"Place sealed plate into a real-time PCR instrument that can detect FAM and VIC/HEX.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a4m55","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2bbep","text":"Set to the conditions below. Be sure to use STANDARD MODE not FAST mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":44,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e0abd","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"efigg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":243,"length":23},{"style":"sup","offset":99,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":164,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":207,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":226,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":340,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":405,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":448,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":468,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","10_0":"","10_1":"","10_2":"","10_3":"","11_0":"","11_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","7_2":"","7_3":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","8_2":"","8_3":"","9_0":"","9_1":"","9_2":"","9_3":""},"colWidths":[null],"data":[["ViiA7 - Standard Mode "],["Step ","Cycles ","Temp ","Time "],["Reverse Transcription ","1 ","50oC ","30 min "],["RT inactivation/initial denaturation ","1 ","95oC ","10 min "],["Amplification ","45 ","95oC ","1 sec "],["56oC ","20sec "],["ABI7500 - Standard Mode "],["Step ","Cycles ","Temp ","Time "],["Reverse Transcription ","1 ","50oC ","30 min "],["RT inactivation/initial denaturation ","1 ","95oC ","10 min "],["Amplification ","45 ","95oC ","15 sec "],["56oC ","30sec "]],"guid":"BCF9A370B72511E88916D1DB482D0BED","mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37h7b","text":"Allow the instrument to analyze the results automatically, any manual threshold or baseline adjustments needs to be recorded and explained.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9nqcn","text":"All samples should be stored until testing is complete and results are reported.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dnbn5","text":"Retention of the sample is necessary to re-run the test when required.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a76ok","text":"RNA should be stored at -80oC for long term storage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vohs","text":"Use the table below to determine if a sample is positive, negative, or inconclusive","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eojs9","text":"If the LN34 result is positive, even in the presence of a negative βA result, the result should be considered positive.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpfh4","text":"If LN34 amplicon is not detected, the βA Ct must be ≤33 for the sample to be considered negative.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8tkk4","text":"βA Ct values determine the quality, suitability, and potential inhibition of the sample being tested. Some samples may fail to exhibit βA growth curves due to low concentration in the original clinical specimen. Failure to detect β-actin in any clinical sample may indicate: ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"jupd","text":"Improper extraction of RNA from clinical materials resulting in loss of RNA or carryover of PCR inhibitors from clinical specimens","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64fc8","text":" ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7l8d","text":"Improper assay set up and execution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1a13b","text":" ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cvajk","text":"Inadequate clinical sample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"99don","text":" ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fr84p","text":"Reagent or equipment malfunction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7lpkg","text":" ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"24klo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"elc50","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ro87","text":" "],["Inconclusive ","35–45 ","Any ","Repeat or additional testing required ","Possible contamination, insufficient sample, inhibition, or low virus load "],["Inconclusive ","Not detected ","> 33 or Not detected ","Repeat or additional testing required ","Possible inhibition or insufficient sample                             "]],"guid":"BCFED390B72511E88916D1DB482D0BED","mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"300g1","text":"Quality Controls REQUIRED for each run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":17,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ekua5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fc2tb","text":"The LN34 Ct value of the positive control RNA should be within the range provided by CDC for that lot of positive control RNA. If the positive control replicate reactions do not cross the threshold within the specified range, invalidate the run and repeat the assay. The positive control RNA will not amplify in the βA assay.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bn2bm","text":"The no template control (NTC) reactions should not exhibit growth curves that cross the threshold line for either the LN34 or the βA assay. If amplification is observed in the NTC, it may indicate contamination. Invalidate the run and repeat testing for all samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fk9rm","text":"All replicates for a given sample should amplify for a valid positive result. If only a subset of replicates amplify in either assay, the sample should be re-tested.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bq98a","text":"Any sample producing highly variable results (Ct value differences \u003e 5 between replicates) should be considered invalid and the sample should be re-tested.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cr1r8","text":"Negative sample or NTC reactions where one out of three replicates exhibits Ct values greater than 38 and the remainder of replicates showed no amplification can be considered negative/no amplification for that assay only for one sample per assay run.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1nvul","text":"IMPORTANT: For rabies rule-out, tissue representing a full cross section of non-fixed brain stem must be tested. For all other samples, we suggest reporting negative LN34 test result as INCONCLUSIVE for rabies, because viral presence in other tissues can be delayed, low abundance, intermittent, or not existent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72aig","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b3kd","text":"A positive LN34 test result can be used to identify the presence of virus in a variety of tissues and tissue conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c5t2","text":"Inconclusive Samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"83q9t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8t3n5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ngvb","text":"All inconclusive samples must be re-tested. If the sample is inconclusive upon repeat testing and all controls performed as expected, re-extraction of RNA is recommended.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7382n","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ghm9","text":"Ct value from 33 – 45 in the βA assay may indicate PCR inhibition. In the case where LN34 is negative and βA Ct is between 33 and 45, dilute RNA samples and repeat testing.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e3nr2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bopfp","text":"Ct value from 33 – 45 or no amplification in the βA assay may indicate failed RNA extraction. Repeat extraction for such samples, then repeat LN34 assay.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b4u90","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eet37","text":"Ct value from 35 – 45 in the LN34 assay may indicate contamination, low virus load, PCR inhibition, or failed extraction. Collect a new piece of brain stem from the original tissue, perform RNA extraction, and re-test the sample.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"77ee9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1kt3c","text":"If a result remains inconclusive for a given sample after repeated testing, use a secondary method such as the DFA test, dRIT, or virus isolation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"47n0f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"btq9t","text":"A rabies positive sample extracted from properly collected and stored brain tissue is expected to have a Ct value less than 35 cycles for the LN34 assay. Samples with low viral RNA (LN34 Ct \u003e 35) and very high total RNA (βA Ct \u003c 25) may indicate potential problems with the assay, sample, or extraction, in particular sample contamination if positive rabies samples were processed on the same day. Re-extract and re-test the sample. If the issue persists, please share results and samples with CDC.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6502","text":"Limitations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ckfod","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ctrj4","text":"This assay does not differentiate between lyssaviruses","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"80pqd","text":"If inhibitors are present in an RNA extraction, PCR assays may produce a false negative result.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5hb56","text":"If inhibition of the β-actin control reactions is noted for a particular sample, extracted RNA should be tested at 2 or more dilutions (e.g., 1:10 and 1:100) to verify the result.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nrr4","text":"Wadhwa, A., et al., A Pan-Lyssavirus Taqman Real-Time RT-PCR Assay for the Detection of Highly Variable Rabies virus and Other Lyssaviruses. PLoS Negl Trop Dis, 2017. 11(1): p. e0005258.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":120},{"style":"bold","offset":167,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8v4o1","text":"Wakeley, P.R., et al., Development of a real-time, TaqMan reverse transcription-PCR assay for detection and differentiation of lyssavirus genotypes 1, 5, and 6. J Clin Microbiol, 2005. 43(6): p. 2786-92.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":137},{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aavrl","text":"Hoffmann, B., et al., Improved safety for molecular diagnosis of classical rabies viruses by use of a TaqMan real-time reverse transcription-PCR 'double check' strategy. J Clin Microbiol, 2010. 48(11): p. 3970-8.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":147},{"style":"bold","offset":194,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5iddu","text":"Join us in advancing global genomic surveillance of the rabies virus.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":69},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"454th","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5uu8","text":"We are actively engaged in pioneering a pan-clade whole genome amplicon sequencing protocol for the rabies virus. If you're interested in collaborating on this crucial endeavor and wish to obtain a primer aliquot from our established protocol or the one currently in development, please do not hesitate to contact us at richardssalvato@gmail.com. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":347},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":347}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n9iq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9kpa","text":"Background","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31r5f","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30odr","text":"Rabies virus (RABV) causes fatal encephalitis in domestic animals and humans. This high-impact zoonotic virus is poorly studied from the genomic perspective so establishing genomic surveillance protocols for RABV is crucial to track their evolution and monitor spillover events and wildlife reservoirs. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8at98","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34q3","text":"Despite the importance of RABV zoonotic cycle, there is limited complete genome sequence data of RABVs from some hosts as bats. We developed a novel rapidly deployable, cost-effective, and flexible amplicon-based sequencing approach usable with protocols widely established during the COVID-19 pandemic and suitable to different hosts based on a one-health context. We used PrimalScheme to generate a primers panel and then aligned them with a RABV sequences dataset from different species and manually degenerated the primers to cover a wider diversity of hosts. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6sc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97t5r","text":"The set of 47 primers is compatible and ready to use with COVIDSeq sequencing protocol and Illumina DNA Prep, and allows to sequence up to 384 samples per run on the Illumina MiSeq system or to accommodate in libraries with other sample types. Additionally, we included primers for amplification of a fragment of the mitochondrial gene COI to host species identification. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6519m","text":"COI","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":3}],"data":{}},{"key":"5irno","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r6fi","text":"Initial Validation ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mel","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lkun","text":"In the initial validation, we sequenced 160 complete RABV genomes from different species from five distinct families (Bovine, Equine, Caprine, Felines, Microchiroptera) with an average coverage of 98%, most of them recovering the whole genome (88/160). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mtfc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drti9","text":"Conclusions","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bbfr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hi7c","text":"Here, we introduced a cost-effective and easy-to-use sequencing protocol for RABV bat-clade in order to support genomic surveillance of a re-emerging zoonotic disease allowing targeting viral control programs and adequate public health policies.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j3ve","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97j0r","text":"Acknowledgements","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfcvf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2rk8","text":"We would like to thank Instituto de Pesquisas Veterinárias Desidério Finamor for sample processing and initial rabies virus diagnosis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgvco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55c1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkl81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bek3h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"419DADC135354031A145A55F7FE4BF55","url":"https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pntd.0006767"}}}}
